info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 04 at 2:33PM EDT until August 04 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN BEAVER...NORTHERN WASHINGTON AND WEST CENTRAL ALLEGHENY COUNTIES... At 233 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles south of Shippingport, or 10 miles west of Moon Township, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Imperial, Sturgeon-Noblestown, Frankfort Springs, Pittsburgh International Airport, Enlow, Hanover Township, Raccoon Creek State Park, and North Fayette Township. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
